messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] falcons and hawks
messages.msgSnippet: This is interesting.  My girls and I have just finished listening to My Side of the Mountain, The Other Side of the Mountain and Frightful s Mountain and they
messages.messageBody:
This is interesting. My girls and I have just finished listening to My Side of the
Mountain, The Other Side of the Mountain and Frightful's Mountain and they now dream
of being falconers. Where do you get flacons and hawks? I know it is a pretty strict
licencing schedule for it all.

What state do you live in?

Tarla

On 11 Jun 2002 at 13:01, Karin wrote:

>
> <starsuncloud@...> wrote:
>
> > I'm not ready yet though. I need more time to prepare my property,
> buy
> > equipment and mentally prepare myself for hacking up cute little
> rabbits
> and
> > squirrels. >>
>
> You'll really have to hack up rabbits and squirrels, Ren?
> Do you have to kill them too or do you just buy rabbit and squirrel
> meat to
> feed your hawk?
>
> > Seems quite a strange sport for an almost vegetarian eh? I must be
> nuts.
> >>
>
> I'd say you're already a very dedicated falconer, if you're willing
> to go
> through all this trouble!
>
> > I will start with a Red-tailed Hawk. >>
>
> What kinds of things will you do with your hawk?
>
> > Can't get rid of this feeling of complete excitement and awe
> though....it's
> > definitely something I've always dreamed of doing. >>
>
> It does sound very exciting to be able to handle a falcon or hawk
> like that.
> How did you realize you had this dream. Did you know someone who was
> a
> falconer?
> I'm just curious.
>
> We recently had a wildlife bird organization come out to our last
> homeschool
> group gathering and give us a fantastic "show" of the birds like
> hawks and
> owls that they brought for us to see up close. Those birds are
> amazing.
>
> Karin
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] falcons and hawks
messages.msgSnippet: ... and ... You ll really have to hack up rabbits and squirrels, Ren? Do you have to kill them too or do you just buy rabbit and squirrel meat to feed your
messages.messageBody:
<starsuncloud@...> wrote:

> I'm not ready yet though. I need more time to prepare my property, buy
> equipment and mentally prepare myself for hacking up cute little rabbits
and
> squirrels. >>

You'll really have to hack up rabbits and squirrels, Ren?
Do you have to kill them too or do you just buy rabbit and squirrel meat to
feed your hawk?

> Seems quite a strange sport for an almost vegetarian eh? I must be nuts.
>>

I'd say you're already a very dedicated falconer, if you're willing to go
through all this trouble!

> I will start with a Red-tailed Hawk. >>

What kinds of things will you do with your hawk?

> Can't get rid of this feeling of complete excitement and awe
though....it's
> definitely something I've always dreamed of doing. >>

It does sound very exciting to be able to handle a falcon or hawk like that.
How did you realize you had this dream. Did you know someone who was a
falconer?
I'm just curious.

We recently had a wildlife bird organization come out to our last homeschool
group gathering and give us a fantastic "show" of the birds like hawks and
owls that they brought for us to see up close. Those birds are amazing.

Karin
